title: Defence Secretary instructs SLAF to standby to airlift patients following bus accident
byline: The Defence Secretary has instructed the Sri Lanka Air Force to keep a Bell 412 helicopter on standby at the Diyatalawa Air Force Base for the potential airlift of patients injured in yesterdayâ€™s bus accident to Colombo for further treatment.

title: No more Govt bungalows for Ministers
byline: Thirty one government bungalows built during the colonial period and allocated to ministers as their official residences in recent times under different governments will be reserved for viable purposes in the future without assigning them to any government official or minister, an informed source said.

title: Measles raising its head again, special vaccination drive to be launched
byline: Though the World Health Organization (WHO) declared Sri Lanka as a country free of measles, the country has been hit by cases once again since 2023, prompting the health authorities to declare a special vaccination week from November 4 to 9, according to a press release from the Health Promotion Bureau of the Health Ministry.

title: Landslide warning issued for eight districts
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) has issued early landslide warnings for eight districts due to the ongoing heavy rainfall.

title: AMS calls for action over misconduct by specialist at Karapitiya Hospital
byline: The Association of Medical Specialists (AMS) has stepped in regarding allegations of abusive conduct by a specialist at the Karapitiya Teaching Hospital, Galle, urging immediate disciplinary action.
